1.speaker: PENGUIN
1.english: Miss Sasako, I want to try something other than a café mocha sometime.

2.speaker: PENGUIN
2.english: What do you suggest? Let's see... I think a café mocha is perfectly fine.

3.speaker: PENGUIN
3.english: Could you think about it a little longer, Miss Sasako?

6.speaker: POLAR BEAR
6.japanese: 新メニューで出そうと思って
6.english: I've been thinking about adding this to the menu.

7.speaker: POLAR BEAR
7.english: Want to try it? It's crab bread.

9.speaker: PENGUIN
9.japanese: じゃあ　それもらおうかな
9.english: Sure, I'll give it a shot. Just came out of the oven.

11.speaker: PENGUIN
11.japanese: 基本　リアルさいらないんじゃないかなぁ
11.english: I don't know that "realism" is really an important factor for bread.

12.speaker: POLAR BEAR
12.japanese: タラバガニのほうがよかった
12.english: Would a red king crab have been better?

13.speaker: PENGUIN
13.japanese: 種類じゃなくて　表現の問題かな
13.english: I don't think the species is the issue. I think it's the presentation.

14.speaker: PENGUIN
14.japanese: どうしたの パンダくん

15.speaker: PANDA
15.japanese: どうしてもバイト行きたくないんだよ
15.english: I really don't want to go to work today.

16.speaker: PANDA
16.japanese: ペンギンさん　代わりにバイト行ってくれない？
16.english: Will you go to work for me, Mr. Penguin?

17.speaker: PENGUIN
17.japanese: キミ…　年中　そんなこと言ってるね
17.english: You say that all year long, don't you?

18.speaker: PANDA
18.japanese: いつもは ただの行きたくないだけどね
18.english: Usually it's a normal feeling of not wanting to go, but I {\i1}really{\i0} don't want to go today.

19.speaker: PENGUIN
19.japanese: はい　そうですか 代わりに　バイト行きましょう
19.english: "Oh, okay sure. Well, in that case, I'll totally go for you!"

20.speaker: PENGUIN
20.japanese: なんて言う人は　世界中探してもいないんじゃないかなぁ
20.english: Do you think there's anybody in the world who'd say that?

21.speaker: POLAR BEAR
21.japanese: 青いバンダナ　シュッとほどいて…
21.english: I fling off my blue bandana...

22.speaker: PENGUIN
22.english: Apparently there was someone, and they were very close by.

23.speaker: PENGUIN
23.japanese: キミ　シロクマくんにちゃんとお礼言ったほうがいいよ
23.english: You need to make sure you thank Polar Bear.

33.speaker: POPO
33.japanese: だから　こんなパンダがいるわけ…
33.english: There's no way a panda would look like...

34.speaker: POLAR BEAR
34.english: See? Could I please see your license {\i1}(menkyosho){\i0}? What?

43.speaker: POPO
43.japanese: シロクマじゃないですか

45.speaker: POPO
45.japanese: 紛らわしいこと やめてくださいよ

47.speaker: SASAKO
47.japanese: ほら　シロクマさんも
47.english: Come on, Mr. Polar Bear. You too.

49.speaker: SASAKO
49.japanese: だから　ダメですって 言ったじゃないですか
49.english: This is why I said you shouldn't do it. I'll make sure to walk next time.

50.speaker: SASAKO
50.japanese: そういう問題じゃありません

51.speaker: POLAR BEAR
51.japanese: それで　パンダくんは

52.speaker: SASAKO
52.japanese: 半田さんから電話があって 動物園に行きました
52.english: He got a phone call from Mr. Handa and went to the zoo.

53.speaker: PANDA
53.japanese: ごめんね　シロクマくん

54.speaker: POLAR BEAR
54.japanese: いいの　いいの パンダくんのせいじゃないから
54.english: It's no problem at all. It's not your fault, Panda.

55.speaker: PANDA
55.japanese: ねえ　シロクマくんが 懲役刑になった　おわびにさ…

56.speaker: POLAR BEAR
56.english: You mean questioned by the police? Yeah.

57.speaker: PANDA
57.japanese: 職務質問になった　おわびにさ
57.english: Since you were questioned by the police...

58.speaker: PANDA
58.japanese: 明日は１日 僕がカフェの仕事するから
58.english: As an apology, I'll work at the café tomorrow.

59.speaker: PANDA
59.japanese: シロクマくんは１日休んでよ
59.english: So you should take the day off, Polar Bear.

61.speaker: PANDA
61.english: Okay? Take it easy, Polar Bear.

62.speaker: PENGUIN
62.japanese: どうしたの　パンダくん
62.english: What's with you all a sudden, Panda?

63.speaker: POLAR BEAR
63.japanese: それじゃ　いってきます
63.english: All right, I'll be off, then.

65.speaker: SASAKO
65.english: Are you really going, Mr. Polar Bear?

66.speaker: POLAR BEAR
66.japanese: パンダくんに任せとけば 大丈夫　大丈夫
66.english: Everything will be fine if we leave it to Panda.

67.speaker: SASAKO
67.japanese: おもしろがってません

71.speaker: GRIZZLY
71.english: Why the hell are you drinking? That means I have to drive the whole time!

74.speaker: PANDA
74.english: Miss Sasako, let's do our best.

77.speaker: PENGUIN
77.japanese: あっ　パンダくん ほんとに　バイトしてるの
77.english: Oh, you were serious about working here part-time, Panda? Just for a day.

78.speaker: PANDA
78.japanese: 明日からは　いつも以上にのんびりするよ
78.english: I'm going to be relaxing even more than usual starting tomorrow.

79.speaker: PENGUIN
79.japanese: その宣言はいらないんじゃないかな
79.english: I don't think you need to announce that.

80.speaker: PANDA
80.japanese: でも　今日は頑張るよ
80.english: But I'm going to work hard today.

83.speaker: PANDA
83.japanese: どうぞ　お水です ごゆっくり
83.english: Here you go, have some water. Please take your time.

84.speaker: PENGUIN
84.japanese: パンダくん　僕　キミの前でどれだけカフェモカ飲んだかしれないよ
84.english: Panda, I can't even count how many times I've had a café mocha in front of you.

86.speaker: PENGUIN
86.japanese: 今日は　お客さん来ないね
86.english: There doesn't seem to be any customers coming today.

89.speaker: CUSTOMER2
89.english: Looks like it. Let's try another day.

90.speaker: SASAKO
90.japanese: あれ　鍵が閉まってる

92.speaker: PANDA
92.japanese: 開けると　お客さん来ちゃうから 閉めといたよ
92.english: If I unlocked the doors, customers would come in, so I kept them locked. Wha?

93.speaker: PANDA
93.japanese: いつも　シロクマくんが 忙しい忙しいって言ってるでしょ
93.english: Polar Bear is always saying how busy he is, right?

94.speaker: SASAKO
94.japanese: そっか　気持は嬉しいけど 鍵は開けとこうね
94.english: I see. I appreciate the concern, but let's keep the doors unlocked.

95.speaker: PANDA
95.japanese: わかった　お客さんは 来たほうがいいんだね
95.english: Okay. So it's better if customers come, right?

96.speaker: PANDA
96.japanese: じゃあ　お客さん来たら どこまで　セルフサービスにする
96.english: Then if we get customers, how much should we make the customers do themselves?

97.speaker: SASAKO
97.japanese: え～と　基本　うちは 全部　私たちでやるかな
97.english: Um, we usually do it all ourselves.

99.speaker: LADY
99.english: Do you have any seats open? Yes, but you'd be sharing a table with someone else. Is that all right?

103.speaker: SASAKO
103.japanese: すみません　あいたらすぐ別の席を用意しますから
103.english: I apologize. We'll show you to another seat as soon as one opens up.

104.speaker: PANDA
104.japanese: ごゆっくり　どうぞ

105.speaker: GIRL
105.japanese: 注文　お願いします
105.english: Could you take our order, please?

106.speaker: PANDA
106.japanese: あぁ　はい　今　行きます
106.english: Oh, okay. I'll be right with you.

107.speaker: SASAKO
107.japanese: パンダくん　お料理よろしくね
107.english: Don't forget about the food, too, Panda.

108.speaker: PANDA
108.english: Okay. Thank you very much. I'm serious.

109.speaker: LADY
109.japanese: やだよ　この子ったら

110.speaker: LION
110.japanese: じゃあ　ばあちゃん　またな

112.speaker: SASAKO
112.japanese: あっ　シロクマさん お帰りなさい
112.english: Oh, Mr. Polar Bear. Welcome back.

114.speaker: GRIZZLY
114.japanese: じゃあな　シロクマ

115.speaker: POLAR BEAR
115.english: See you later. Oh, welcome back.

116.speaker: POLAR BEAR
116.japanese: ただいま　パンダくんは

117.speaker: SASAKO
117.japanese: いますよ　今日１日パンダくんほんとに頑張ってくれたんですよ
117.english: He's here. Panda worked really hard all day today.

118.speaker: SASAKO
118.japanese: ペンギンさんが 手伝おうかって言っても僕やるからって
118.english: Even when Mr. Penguin offered to help, he kept saying he'd do it himself.

119.speaker: PENGUIN
119.japanese: で　急に声がしなくなったと思ったら
119.english: Then I noticed that I haven't heard him in a while...

123.speaker: POLAR BEAR
123.japanese: パンダくんに任せとけば大丈夫だって言ったでしょ
123.english: I told you everything would be okay if we left it up to Panda.

125.speaker: PANDA
125.japanese: シロクマくんは休んでいてよ

126.speaker: POLAR BEAR
126.japanese: 気にしなくていいのに
126.english: You don't need to be worried about that.

130.speaker: RIN RIN
130.english: Thanks for your hard work. Here.

132.speaker: RIN RIN
132.japanese: またね 日曜日も頑張ってね
132.english: See you later! Do your best on Sunday, too!

135.speaker: PENGUIN
135.japanese: どうしてもって言うなら

136.speaker: PENGUIN
136.japanese: 僕がイスに座る瞬間を見せてあげてもいいよ
136.english: I'll show you how I get onto a chair.

137.speaker: SASAKO
137.japanese: すみません　今忙しいから パッとなら見ます
137.english: I'm sorry, but I'm rather busy right now, so I'll look if it'll be quick.

138.speaker: PENGUIN
138.japanese: じゃあいいや　時間あるときで
138.english: Never mind then. I'll do it when you have time.

141.speaker: POLAR BEAR
141.japanese: どうしてもって言うなら…

142.speaker: POLAR BEAR
142.japanese: 僕がアザラシじゃなく　セイウチを捕まえるところ 見せてあげるよ
142.english: I'll show you how I catch a walrus, instead of a seal.

143.speaker: PENGUIN
143.japanese: そこは　ぜひ遠慮しとくよ
143.english: I will gladly decline that offer.

146.speaker: PANDA
146.japanese: また　もらっちゃったよ…

148.speaker: PANDA
148.japanese: ペンギンさん　今から ダッシュで行って返してきてよ
148.english: Would you go return these in a hurry for me, Mr. Penguin?

149.speaker: PENGUIN
149.japanese: ダッシュする必要あるかな
149.english: Is there a reason for me to hurry?

150.speaker: RIN RIN
150.japanese: 今日もパンダくん かわいかったな
150.english: Panda was so cute again today.

151.speaker: RIN RIN
151.japanese: いらっしゃい すみません　留守にしちゃって
151.english: Welcome! Sorry to keep you waiting!

152.speaker: GIRL1
152.english: Oh, it's fine. Um, Mr. Panda asked me to give you this letter.

153.speaker: RIN RIN
153.japanese: えっ　パンダくんから

154.speaker: RIN RIN
154.japanese: 本当　ありがとうございます

155.speaker: RIN RIN
155.japanese: 今夜８時　バードランドで待ってます
155.english: I'll be waiting for you at Bird Land at 8 PM.

158.speaker: RIN RIN
158.english: I hope this is the place.

161.speaker: RIN RIN
161.japanese: ああ　常勤パンダさん

162.speaker: RIN RIN
162.japanese: あの…　パンダくんは？

163.speaker: FT PANDA
163.english: Why don't you take a seat?

164.speaker: RIN RIN
164.japanese: えっと　僕 パンダくんと待ち合わせなんですが
164.english: Um... I'm supposed to be meeting up with Panda.

165.speaker: FT PANDA
165.japanese: ああそれね　あたし　あたし　あたしがね呼んだの
165.english: Oh, I'm the one that sent that letter. I'm the one that invited you. But Panda—

166.speaker: FT PANDA
166.japanese: パンダくん　パンダくんって あたしだってパンダでしょ
166.english: Oh, Panda this, Panda that... I'm a panda, too!

167.speaker: FT PANDA
167.japanese: まあ　座って ほら　いいから
167.english: Come and have a seat. Come on.

169.speaker: FT PANDA
169.japanese: ビールでいいかな？　林さん
169.english: Is beer okay with you, Mr. Hayashi?

173.speaker: PANDA
173.japanese: 誰かに　僕の　かわいさを 分けてあげたいんだよ
173.english: I want to share a bit of my cuteness with someone.

174.speaker: PENGUIN
174.japanese: 相談の件　取り消していいかな
174.english: Could I withdraw my offer to give advice?

175.speaker: PANDA
175.japanese: 僕　かわいさを 持て余しちゃってるんだよね

176.speaker: PENGUIN
176.japanese: 笹子さん　カフェモカ　おかわり
176.english: Could I get another café mocha, Miss Sasako?

179.speaker: RIN RIN
179.japanese: あの…　常勤パンダさんが 僕に何の用ですか
179.english: Pardon me, but, what exactly did you want with me, Mr. Full-time Panda?

180.speaker: FT PANDA
180.japanese: 林さん　あなた同じパンダなのに
180.english: Mr. Hayashi. We're both pandas, but you're always going on and on about how cute Panda is.

181.speaker: FT PANDA
181.japanese: どうして　私のことは かわいいって言わないんですか
181.english: Why don't you ever call me cute?

182.speaker: FT PANDA
182.japanese: あ～　お姉さん あたりめ　ちょうだい
182.english: Hey, Miss! Could I get some dried squid?

184.speaker: FT PANDA
184.japanese: あと　枝豆　追加でね～
184.english: Could you add on some edamame, too?

186.speaker: FT PANDA
186.japanese: ねぇ　どうしてなの

187.speaker: RIN RIN
187.japanese: そういうところですかね…
187.english: I think it's subtle things like that.

188.speaker: FT PANDA
188.japanese: なにしたって　かわいいでしょう パンダなんだから
188.english: Everything that I do should be cute! I'm a panda!

189.speaker: RIN RIN
189.english: I wouldn't say that... Hey, Miss! Could I get some dried squid?

191.speaker: FT PANDA
191.japanese: 林さん　なに　ニマニマしてるの
191.english: What are you grinning about, Mr. Hayashi?

193.speaker: RIN RIN
193.japanese: パンダくんで想像したら かわいかったから…
193.english: I was imagining Panda saying that line, and it was really cute. What's so different? We're both pandas!

194.speaker: RIN RIN
194.japanese: 見ます　パンダくんのアルバム
194.english: Do you want to see? It's a photo album of Panda.

195.speaker: FT PANDA
195.japanese: いつも　持ち歩いてるの
195.english: Do you always carry that around?

196.speaker: RIN RIN
196.japanese: 今日パンダくんと 一緒に見ようと思って
196.english: I wanted to go through it with Panda today,

198.speaker: RIN RIN
198.japanese: ほら　かわいいでしょう
198.english: See? Look how cute he is.

199.speaker: FT PANDA
199.japanese: 確かに　かわいいな～　あたしは
199.english: Yeah, he is cute. And me?

200.speaker: RIN RIN
200.japanese: そうですね… 若干　疲れている気がします
200.english: Well, I think you look a bit tired.

201.speaker: FT PANDA
201.japanese: そうだね　くたびれてるね

202.speaker: RIN RIN
202.japanese: これは　掃除機に吸われて 寝グセがついたままのパンダくんです
202.english: Here's a picture of Panda with bedhead after being sucked up by a vacuum.

206.speaker: RIN RIN
206.japanese: そうですね…　内職してますね
206.english: Well... You're doing a side job.

207.speaker: LLAMA
207.japanese: 生活感　ありますね
207.english: You can get a sense of how he lives from that picture.

209.speaker: LLAMA
209.japanese: 僕も　一緒にいいですか

211.speaker: FT PANDA
211.japanese: じゃあ　まず　一杯

212.speaker: LLAMA
212.japanese: ありがとうございます

213.speaker: LLAMA
213.japanese: けど　写真に撮ってもらえるだけ いいですよ
213.english: At least you get pictures taken of you.

214.speaker: LLAMA
214.japanese: 僕なんて お客さん　みんな素通りですよ
214.english: Everyone always passes right by me.

215.speaker: RIN RIN
215.japanese: あっ　動物園の方でしたか
215.english: Oh, so you work at the zoo, too?

217.speaker: WAITRESS
217.japanese: ビールとあたりめです
217.english: Here's your beer and dried squid.

220.speaker: RIN RIN
220.japanese: あ…　そういうの　やめたほうが…
220.english: I don't think that's a good ide—

222.speaker: RIN RIN
222.english: Yes? You must be really popular.

223.speaker: RIN RIN
223.english: You don't handle alcohol well, do you?

226.speaker: FT PANDA
226.japanese: かわいく見られたいよ～ リンランさ～ん
226.english: I want to be seen as cute, Mr. Rin Ran.

228.speaker: RIN RIN
228.japanese: 常勤パンダさん　大丈夫ですか
228.english: Are you all right, Mr. Full-time Panda?

229.speaker: FT PANDA
229.japanese: 明日　動物園　来てよ～

230.speaker: RIN RIN
230.japanese: 明日は パンダくん　いないじゃないですか…
230.english: But Panda won't be there tomorrow.

231.speaker: FT PANDA
231.japanese: あたしが　いるでしょう

234.speaker: RIN RIN
234.japanese: わかりました　行きますよ

235.speaker: FT PANDA
235.japanese: ありがとう　リンロンさ～ん

238.speaker: FT PANDA
238.japanese: やぁ　林さん いや～　ありがとう　ありがとう
238.english: Hey, Mr. Hayashi. Thank you very much.

239.speaker: RIN RIN
239.japanese: 僕　パンダなら 基本 かわいいと思うんですけど…
239.english: I do think that pandas are cute in general...

240.speaker: RIN RIN
240.japanese: なんで　常勤パンダさんはそんなに かわいくはないんだろう
240.english: So I wonder why you aren't that cute, Mr. Full-time Panda...

244.speaker: FT PANDA
244.japanese: 今　パッと済ませちゃうから
244.english: I'll finish it up real quick.

246.speaker: FT PANDA
246.japanese: お客さん少ない日は 結構はかどるんだよ
246.english: I can get through it quite quickly when there aren't any customers around.

247.speaker: RIN RIN
247.japanese: それ…　やめましょうか

248.speaker: RIN RIN
248.japanese: 内職するパンダなんて かわいくないでしょ
248.english: Pandas doing side jobs aren't cute.

250.speaker: PANDA
250.japanese: よいしょ　よいしょ

252.speaker: RIN RIN
252.english: I wonder if it's a matter of potential...

253.speaker: FT PANDA
253.japanese: ちょっと…　諦めないでよ
253.english: Hey, don't give up on me.

254.speaker: RIN RIN
254.japanese: じゃあ　タイヤで遊んでみましょうか
254.english: Well then, how about we have you play with a tire? Sure...

255.speaker: FT PANDA
255.english: How's that? It's cute, but only slightly.

256.speaker: RIN RIN
256.japanese: あぁ　すみません でも大丈夫ですよ
256.english: Oh, I'm sorry! But you'll be fine!

259.speaker: FT PANDA
259.japanese: そこそこの かわいさでいいのかな
259.english: I wonder if I'll be okay being only slightly cute.

260.speaker: RIN RIN
260.japanese: 常勤パンダさんに 悪いことしちゃったなぁ
260.english: I feel bad for what I did to Mr. Full-time Panda.

261.speaker: LLAMA
261.english: Pardon... Oh, Mr. Llama! I'm sorry!

262.speaker: RIN RIN
262.english: I was just looking for you.

263.speaker: RIN RIN
263.japanese: あっ　忘れてないです…　よ
263.english: I didn't forget about you... at all!

266.speaker: KID
266.japanese: 頑張って　パンダさ～ん
266.english: Do your best, Mr. Panda! Look over here!

267.speaker: KID
267.japanese: はぁ…　やっぱりパンダくんにはかなわないなぁ
267.english: So cute! I guess I can't beat Panda.

268.speaker: PANDA
268.english: I'm finally done! Thanks for your hard work, Panda! Here, take this!

271.speaker: GIRL
271.japanese: あの…　一緒に 写メ撮ってもらえますか
271.english: Um, will you take a cell phone picture with us?

274.speaker: GIRL
274.japanese: お花持ってるパンダさんもかわいい
274.english: A panda holding flowers is so cute!

276.speaker: RIN RIN
276.english: Do your best next week, too!

277.speaker: RIN RIN
277.japanese: やっぱり人気者だな かわいいもんな
277.english: He really is popular. Well, he is cute.

280.speaker: GIRLIE
280.english: Mr. Panda! Oh, Panda already le—

283.speaker: GIRLIE
283.japanese: こっちのパンダさんだもん
283.english: I wanted to see you! Here!

287.speaker: GIRLIE
287.japanese: ママ　パンダさんに渡せた
287.english: I got to give them to Mr. Panda, Mommy! Really? Good for you.

288.speaker: GIRLIE
288.japanese: うん　じゃあね　バイバーイ

292.speaker: SASAKO
292.japanese: 座る瞬間　見ますよ　じっくり
292.english: I'll watch you as you sit! Very attentively!

295.speaker: PENGUIN
295.japanese: そんなあらためて 見せるものでもないよ
295.english: It's not that big of a deal.

297.speaker: PANDA
297.japanese: ペンギンさん　ペンギンさん

299.speaker: PANDA
299.japanese: 今頭に浮かんだ話してよ
299.english: Tell us the first thing that comes to mind.

300.speaker: PENGUIN
300.japanese: カラオケで　サビのところでちょっとずれちゃったとき
300.english: When you miss the chorus of a song by a little bit when you're singing karaoke,

301.japanese: どうごまかしたら恥ずかしくないかなぁって
301.english: how do you recover without embarrassing yourself?

302.speaker: PANDA
302.japanese: もっと情熱的に話して

304.speaker: PENGUIN
304.japanese: なるべくこっそりしたい話だよ
304.english: It's something I'd rather talk about quietly.

305.speaker: PENGUIN
305.japanese: というか　白熊君　終わろ
305.english: Actually, let's end this, Polar Bear.

306.speaker: POLAR BEAR
306.japanese: 来週のしろくまカフェはところどころお送りします
306.english: Next week's Polar Bear's Café will be presented in bits and pieces.

307.speaker: PENGUIN
307.english: We'll be presenting the whole thing!
